notes: Title from colophon; each Gospel has separate caption title in red ink.
Place of writing not determined; perhaps Iran.
Paper; cream color, commercial laid paper with no visible chain lines or watermarks; black ink with rubrication; catchwords.
Nastaʻliq; 17 lines in written area 25.5 x 16 cm.
Library of Congress. Persian manuscript, M103.
Nineteenth century brown half leather binding with dark brown grain sides; commercial marbled pastedowns and marbled edging; binding separated from text block.
Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.

title: Chahār Injil-i Muqaddas.
description: Manuscript. Persian. Title from colophon; each Gospel has separate caption title in red ink. Scribe not identified. Place of writing not determined; perhaps Iran. Paper; cream color, commercial laid paper with no visible chain lines or watermarks; black ink with rubrication; catchwords. Nastaʻliq; 17 lines in written area 25.5 x 16 cm. Fol. 1b-128a. Library of Congress. Persian manuscript, M103. Nineteenth century brown half leather binding with dark brown grain sides; commercial marbled pastedowns and marbled edging; binding separated from text block. Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
